DOCUMENT 259
ELECTRONICALLY FILED
8/21/2025 1:38 PM
70-DR-2023-900051.01
CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
AT ALEXANDER CITY
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR )
PLAINTIFF/RESPONDENT )
VS. ) CASE NO. DR-2023-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND )
DEFENDANT/PETITIONER )
MOTION TO CONTINUE
Comes now the Plaintiff/Respondent, by and through his attorney of record, Dianne
James Davis, and files this his Motion to Continue the Final Hearing set for October 17, 2025,
and would state as follows:
1. That this Court entered an Order on the 18th day of August, 2025, granting the
Plaintiff’s Motion to Continue the Final Hearing and any pending motions until
October 17, 2025;
2. That Counsel for Plaintiff has three (3) other Final Hearings on October 17, 2025;
3. That Counsel for the Plaintiff had a deposition of the minor child’s counselor on
August 19, 2025, but due to Counsel having Covid, the deposition had to be
cancelled. The deposition has been rescheduled for September 29, 2025.
4. That due to the number of witnesses and extensive testimony expected in this
final hearing, Plaintiff requests an entire day be set aside.
WHEREFORE, the premises considered, the Plaintiff requests this Honorable Court
continue the Final Hearing in this matter currently set on October 17, 2025, until this Court can
set aside an entire day for this final hearing.
Respectfully submitted this the 21st day of August, 2025.
DOCUMENT 259
/s/Dianne James Davis
Dianne James Davis (DAV007)
Attorney for Plaintiff
107 Main Street
Alexander City, AL 35010
(256) 392-3172

addressed and postage paid in the U.S. Mail on this the 21st day of August, 2025.
Barbara H. Agricola

Opelika, AL 36801
